article_title: A Tired Pilot Is a Tired Pilot, Regardless of the Plane
article_text:
News broke recently that two pilots reported falling asleep while operating a long-haul Airbus 330 flight to the U.K. full of passengers. For an unknown length of time, autopilot kept the aircraft flying. Before the Aug. 13 flight, the pilots had slept only five hours over the previous two nights. The event brings yet another reminder of the dangers posed by fatigued pilots.

The Federal Aviation Administration will soon address the issue, implementing long-overdue new fatigue standards for pilots. But those requirements...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, retired pilot Chesley 'Sully' Sullenberger and Jim Hall write that the FAA's fatigue rules should be the same for cargo jets as for passenger airlines. Otherwise, everyone is at risk.
twitter.title: A Tired Pilot Is a Tired Pilot, Regardless of the Plane

image.alt: Captain Sully and Jim Hall: A Tired Pilot Is a Tired Pilot, Regardless of the Plane

article_summary:
News broke recently that two pilots reported falling asleep while operating a long-haul Airbus 330 flight to the U.K. full of passengers.
Before the Aug. 13 flight, the pilots had slept only five hours over the previous two nights.
The Federal Aviation Administration will soon address the issue, implementing long-overdue new fatigue standards for pilots.
The event brings yet another reminder of the dangers posed by fatigued pilots.
For an unknown length of time, autopilot kept the aircraft flying.
